question: Tujuk-i-Jahangiri was written in which language ?
explanation: Tuzuk-i-Jahangiri (or Jahangirnama) is the autobiography of Mughal Emperor Jahangir who ruled India from 1605 AD to 1627 AD. It is written in Persian. The autobiography is a unique piece of literature that shows his power of expression and observation. In it, he not only provided the history of his reign but also gave details viz. his perception on art, politics and also information about his family.
